meanings.def: not at any time; not on any occasion
examples: You never help me.
He'll never forget her.
He has never been abroad.
She had never seen so much snow.
She left the country, vowing never to return again.
‘Would you vote for him?’ ‘Never.’
‘I work for a company called Orion Technology.’ ‘Never heard of them.’
Never in all my life have I seen such a horrible thing.
Never ever tell anyone your password.
Never before has English cuisine been so stylish.

meanings.def: used to emphasize a negative statement instead of ‘not’
examples: I never knew (= didn't know until now) you had a twin sister.
I never realized just how easy it is.
(especially British English) Someone might find out, and that would never do (= that is not acceptable).
He never so much as smiled (= did not smile even once).
Most people have never even heard of Iggy.
(especially British English) ‘I told my boss exactly what I thought of her.’ ‘You never did!’ (= ‘Surely you didn't!’)
(British English, slang) ‘You took my bike.’ ‘No, I never.’
(old-fashioned or humorous) Never fear (= Do not worry), everything will be all right.

meanings.def: used to say that nothing is impossible
examples: Many thought the book could not become a movie, but with Hollywood never say never.

meanings.def: on hire purchase (= by making payments over a long period)
examples: to buy a new car on the never-never

meanings.def: used to express surprise or disapproval
examples: Well, I never! Fancy getting married and not telling us!

idioms.def: used to say that nothing is impossible
examples: Many thought the book could not become a movie, but with Hollywood never say never.

idioms.def: on hire purchase (= by making payments over a long period)
examples: to buy a new car on the never-never

idioms.def: used to express surprise or disapproval
examples: Well, I never! Fancy getting married and not telling us!

meanings.def: used to show that you are very surprised about something because you do not believe it is possible
examples: ‘I got the job.’ ‘Never!’

meanings.def: used to tell somebody not to worry or be upset
examples: Have you broken it? Never mind, we can buy another one.

meanings.def: used to suggest that something is not important
examples: This isn't where I intended to take you—but never mind, it's just as good.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that what is true about the first thing you have said is even more true about the second
examples: I never thought she'd win once, never mind twice!
